page.title: 16THE LIFE OF CHILDREN.
page.content: The children lead busy lives and are {expected to help around the farm.}Some of them have to bring cows in for milking before going to school.Other jobs expected of them are seasonal like feeding orphaned lambs, helping with sheep shearing and dipping, and silaging and haymaking. Their school day is long as most of them{live many miles from the school } and therefore have to be transported by a taxi service of minibuses. This trip around narrow roads is made even worse during the{bad winters }that are experienced here.Each year the school is closed for a few days due to the heavy snow falls. Most children live on isolated farms and their{friends can live up } {to 4 miles away.}This means a friend will often stay a whole day rather than play for an hour or so.
